:	O

:	O

patient	O
presents	O
with	O

can	O

HISTORY	O
OF	O
THE	O
PRESENT	O
ILLNESS	O
:	O
Nathan	O
is	O
a	O
51-year-old	O
,	O
right-handed	O
man	O
who	O
suffered	O
a	O
large	O
right	O
MCA	O
territory	O
stroke	O
in	O
October	O
2069	O
.	O
	
This	O
occurred	O
in	O
the	O
setting	O
of	O
right	O
internal	O
carotid	O
artery	O
occlusion	O
,	O
and	O
hemicraniectomy	O
was	O
required	O
for	O
management	O
of	O
malignant	O
cerebral	O
edema	O
after	O
the	O
stroke	O
.	O
	
He	O
subsequently	O
developed	O
an	O
infection	O
of	O
the	O
abdominal	O
bone	O
flap	O
.	O
	
His	O
stroke	O
workup	O
revealed	O
a	O
normal	O
echocardiogram	O
and	O
24-hour	O
Holter	O
monitor	O
.	O
	
A	O
hypercoagulability	O
panel	O
was	O
negative	O
.	O
	
Homocysteine	O
was	O
normal	O
.	O
	
Serum	O
lipid	O
analysis	O
revealed	O
mild	O
hypertriglyceridemia	O
.	O
	
His	O
recovery	O
was	O
complicated	O
by	O
brain	O
abscess	O
,	O
which	O
required	O
surgical	O
drainage	O
and	O
prolonged	O
antibiotic	O
therapy	O
.	O
	
Finally	O
an	O
artificial	O
bone	O
flap	O
was	O
replaced	O
in	O
October	O
2070	O
.	O
	
He	O
then	O
developed	O
persistent	O
nausea	O
and	O
vomiting	O
and	O
a	O
pseudomeningocele	O
.	O
	
A	O
VP	O
shunt	O
was	O
placed	O
by	O
Dr.	O
Bennett	O
.	O
	
Unfortunately	O
,	O
even	O
after	O
shunting	O
there	O
was	O
persistent	O
nausea	O
and	O
vomiting	O
.	O
	
This	O
turned	O
out	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
side	O
effect	O
of	O
Fentanyl	O
patch	O
use	O
.	O
	
The	O
Fentanyl	O
was	O
subsequently	O
replaced	O
with	O
methadone	O
for	O
chronic	O
left-sided	O
neuropathic	O
pain	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
nausea	O
and	O
vomiting	O
abated	O
.	O
	
I	O
last	O
saw	O
Nathan	O
on	O
April	O
2nd	O
of	O
this	O
year	O
at	O
which	O
point	O
he	O
was	O
doing	O
quite	O
well	O
.	O
	
He	O
complained	O
of	O
some	O
hot	O
flashes	O
of	O
unclear	O
etiology	O
.	O
	
His	O
depression	O
seemed	O
to	O
be	O
under	O
better	O
control	O
on	O
Celexa	O
.	O
	
Today	O
he	O
reports	O
that	O
he	O
continues	O
to	O
have	O
trouble	O
with	O
neuropathic	O
pain	O
on	O
the	O
left	O
side	O
of	O
his	O
body	O
.	O
	
Fortunately	O
he	O
has	O
managed	O
to	O
wean	O
himself	O
off	O
of	O
methadone	O
and	O
this	O
has	O
not	O
caused	O
the	O
pain	O
to	O
get	O
any	O
worse	O
.	O
	
He	O
is	O
using	O
a	O
substantial	O
dose	O
of	O
Neurontin	O
,	O
which	O
he	O
thinks	O
is	O
helpful	O
.	O
	
He	O
complains	O
that	O
these	O
pains	O
involve	O
his	O
face	O
,	O

,	O
and	O
leg	O

the	O

,	O

at	O

are	O

.	O
	
His	O

complaint	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
relates	O
to	O
the	O
hot	O
flashes	O
that	O
he	O
mentioned	O
at	O
our	O
last	O
visit	O
.	O
	
These	O
often	O
occur	O
several	O

daily	O

although	O
they	O
may	O
not	O

for	O
several	O
days	O

a	O

.	O

explains	O
that	O

his	O

.	O

has	O

a	O

of	O
heat	O

if	O

.	O

not	O
to	O

.	O

very	O

Hospital	O
.	O
	
This	O
is	O
very	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
consistent	O
with	O
lymphoma	O
.	O
	
I	O
discussed	O
lymphoma	O
in	O
general	O
terms	O
with	O
the	O
patient	O
and	O
his	O
son	O
.	O
	
I	O
informed	O
them	O
that	O
many	O
lymphomas	O
were	O
treatable	O
and	O
some	O

them	O
would	O
indeed	O

.	O

would	O
all	O

on	O

exact	O
histology	O
that	O
was	O

by	O
biopsy	O
.	O

sites	O
of	O
biopsy	O
would	O
be	O

left	O

region	O
.	O
	
I	O
informed	O

that	O
would	O
be	O

of	O

,	O
we	O
have	O
a	O
morbidly	obesity_mention
obese	obesity_mention
gentleman	O
with	O

that	O

on	O

24	O
hours	O
a	O

seven	O
days	O

compresses	O

lower	O

.	O

.	O

The	O
constellation	O
of	O
myalgias	O
,	O
arthralgias/synovitis	O
,	O
?	O
pleurisy	O
,	O
Raynaud	O
's	O
,	O
GERD	O
,	O
HTN	O

this	O

can	O
present	O
without	O
skin	O

(	O

is	O
c/w	O
possible	O
crystal	O
disease	O
.	O

is	O
typical	O

but	O
progression	O
to	O
involve	O
other	O
joints	O

as	O
the	O
knee	O
is	O
not	O
.	O

is	O
another	O
consideration	O
given	O
the	O
quick	O
resolution	O
of	O
the	O
process	O
.	O
	
Her	O
myalgias	O
may	O
well	O
represent	O
underlying	O
fibromyalgia	O
.	O
